meanings.definition: People who oppose modern ideas or practices.
meanings.sent1: The antimoderns in the village prefer traditional customs.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts that appealed to the antimoderns.
meanings.sent3: The antimoderns organized a protest against the new technology, but ended up using smartphones to coordinate.
meanings.sent4: In a world of progress, the antimoderns stand like ancient statues, unmoving and resistant.
meanings.sent5: The antimoderns' passion for the past burns brighter than the sun itself.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of a group opposed to modern ideas or practices.
meanings.sent1: The antimoderns movement gained momentum among the youth.
meanings.sent2: Her antimoderns fashion sense clashed with the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: The antimoderns-themed party was a hit, with guests dressing in vintage attire.
meanings.sent4: The old house had an antimoderns charm that attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent5: The antimoderns architecture of the building stood out in the modern cityscape.
